intro: Marlierea vicina, commonly known as the common marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its small, tubular flowers are usually white or pale pink and are arranged in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
